author: Daring Fireball Department of Commerce
description:
Prompt, run, edit, and deploy full-stack web and mobile apps with Bolt, the AI-powered web development agent that brings coding to your browser.

Bolt lets you build, edit, and test web applications in real time with simple, chat-based prompts. No experience needed.

👉 Try it now at bolt.new.

 ★
title: [Sponsor] Bolt: What Do You Want to Build?

author: John Gruber
description:
Nathan Ingraham, writing for Engadget:

There are a lot of rumors flying around about a big iOS and macOS redesign coming this year, perhaps as a distraction to the continued issues around Apple Intelligence. And while I’m game for a fresh coat of paint across the software I use every single day, I have one plea while Apple’s at it: Please, for the love of god, make the Notes app render the letter “a” properly.

I’ve been meaning to rant about this ever since Vesper went under and I switched to Apple Notes. I absolutely despise the alternate single-story a glyph that Apple Notes uses. I use Notes every single day and
title: That Stupid Apple Notes ‘a’
